alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Davidson; Robertson; Sumner; Williamson; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 5:43PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Davidson, southwestern Sumner, northern Williamson, northwestern Wilson, central Cheatham and southern Robertson Counties through 630 PM CST... At 543 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Coopertown to near Pegram to near Fairview. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Gallatin, Springfield, Ashland City, Nashville, Madison, Hendersonville, Brentwood, La Vergne, Mount Juliet, Goodlettsville, White House, Millersville, Greenbrier, Nolensville, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Coopertown, Belle Meade and Kingston Springs. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 183 and 227. Interstate 65 between mile markers 64 and 107. Interstate 24 between mile markers 23 and 63. Interstate 840 between mile markers 7 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cheatham; Davidson; Robertson; Sumner; Williamson; Wilson
